Custom CSS and Javascript
These settings allow adding custom CSS and Javascript that will be used within the Form.io portal. You must also include the CSS or javascript within your app to see the same functionality. Common uses of these settings are to have the form preview have the same styling as your application and to include custom components into the form builder.

It is recommended to wrap all CSS classes with a custom class specific to a project. Otherwise theses styles will apply to all projects once loaded. You can use the .{{ currentProject.name}}Form class to target only forms in this project.

Custom Javascript is useful for adding custom components to a project.

Form Module

A form module is a way to extend the basic functionality of the Form.io Renderer by allowing custom logic to be introduced into the runtime evaluation of a rendered form. This functionality is documented on the Github Wiki Documentation.

Global Functions Example

An example use case is to inject custom global functions into the evaluation context for Custom Vaidations, Calculated Values, etc.

{
  options: {
    form: {
      evalContext: {
        validatePhone: function(input) {
          return input.match(/^[2-9]\d{2}-\d{3}-\d{4}$/);
        }
      }
    }
  }
}

This code could now be used within Custom Validation using the following.

valid = validatePhone(input) ? true : 'Phone number is invalid';

Custom Form Builder Example

This feature can also be used to inject a custom Form Builder by either creating "Pre-defined" components or Custom Components. The following code will inject a new form builder section called "Pre-Defined Components" and allow the form builders to drag and drop these fields into the forms.

{
  options: {
    builder: {
      builder: {
        custom: {
          title: 'Pre-Defined Fields',
          weight: 10,
          components: {
            firstName: {
              title: 'First Name',
              key: 'firstName',
              icon: 'terminal',
              schema: {
                label: 'First Name',
                type: 'textfield',
                key: 'firstName',
                input: true
              }
            },
            lastName: {
              title: 'Last Name',
              key: 'lastName',
              icon: 'terminal',
              schema: {
                label: 'Last Name',
                type: 'textfield',
                key: 'lastName',
                input: true
              }
            },
            email: {
              title: 'Email',
              key: 'email',
              icon: 'at',
              schema: {
                label: 'Email',
                type: 'email',
                key: 'email',
                input: true
              }
            },
            phoneNumber: {
              title: 'Mobile Phone',
              key: 'mobilePhone',
              icon: 'phone-square',
              schema: {
                label: 'Mobile Phone',
                type: 'phoneNumber',
                key: 'mobilePhone',
                input: true
              }
            }
          }
        }
      }
    }
  }
}
